item.title: How the FUCK can my colleagues sense that i am...off? — 37 replies — 91.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
How the FUCK can my colleagues sense that i am...off?

Open thread • Replies: 37 • Updated: 2026-02-27 12:33 UTC

OP

How the FUCK can my colleagues sense that i am...off? I thought i was acting normalfag and friendly.. is it my eyes or what? Or is it because i'm single? Fuck waging. I hope whoever slighted me dies slow and in extreme pain. Does anybody know this feel?

Early replies (first 3)

61907359
>>61907350
normies are very good at detecting autism, they have a 99%+ accuracy rate

61907374
Its because youre single and a man. Single women are treated fine but single men are treated like homosexuals and rapists. Fuck this society

61907379
>>61907350
The trick is to not really hide the crazy
They're programmed to kind of like lunatics so long as you don't fully let go, and so long as you aren't incredibly hideous or uncharismatic

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61907400
Your faux normalfag mask slips inbetween the cracks, the tone and cadence of your voice, body language, facial expressions etc

61907422
>>61907350
you ooze autism its very noticeable

61907446
>>61907422
Oh bobo how do I blend in with the normies like the jew does.

61907471
>>61907391
I knew an autistic girl, she ended up with a normalfag chad like everyone else

61907516
>>61907350
American corruption is really ridiculous

61907523
>>61907471
Not autistic enough thoughbeit

61907603
>>61907350
People can tell when you're struggling to act, pretend, trying to follow a script, etc. People are pretty good at detecting insincerity. The sheer number of dipshits that believe whatever their favorite Youtuber says might suggest otherwise, but that's really just a testament to how prolific skilled actors have become.
You can detect "soul" from "soulless" in content the same way. You spot AI images the same way, and you used to spot Photoshopped images the same way.
>I thought i was acting normalfag and friendly
Yeah, people can tell you're putting an inordinate amount of effort into acting "normal". They notice that you're not comfortable, and that makes them suspicious. It's a catch-22. You want to follow the social script, but you adhere to your image of it too strictly. Because you don't actually, in action, understand it. This is because you were not "properly socialized" as a child <- that's what people mean when they talk about socializing children.

61907652
its a combination of signals not just one thing.

61907688
>>61907350
Fuck what they think, anon.

61907712
Who gives a fuck. Stop worrying so much. Just remember the Pepe toasting. That’s it.

61907735
>>61907350
You are being socially rejected/ isolated. It hurts for the first few years upto a decade but gets better after you go through the extreme mental suffering that makes you delve into deeper parts of yourself until you grow into a different person. It's not just other people who don't like you but time itself dosen't like your biology, the very crux of existence, that we are both alive and dead at the same time.

61907740
>>61907603
>>61907350
Or it could just be your negativity. Hatred of "normies" shines through the act and turns people away within seconds of interacting with you.
...You're not one of those faggots that only ever talk about things they hate, are you?

61908479
>Be treated by others as a beast
>Be a furry because it's fun to imagine that I actually am and not just a broken human
I think I would actually be better-accepted if I was a towering, hulking animal man, built for inspiring lizard-brain fear and distrust. Less dissonance.

61908493
>>61907385
Because we used to be their overlords in ancient societies. People with autism and the best overseers of golden age civilizations.

Jewish psychopaths are the antagonist of us autists and have taken over as the overlords and have made it their mission to program the normies to hate us because we are the biggest threat to world Jewry

61908514
I'm a 3 usually but became a 5 for a few days until they shipped me off to the funny farm

Only way for non-neurotypicals to unironically make it (not have a black nurse when we are on death's door) is to start your own business. Yes your business can be trading but if you do you have to take it seriously and stop gambling with your main bucket

61908567
Why is all of Gen Z number 4?
Also OP, you can tell if someone gooned recently. Normies don't know what they are sensing but I know that sense.

61908601
>>61908479
Faggot

61908672
>>61908493
So sad Germany lost WW2 I curse those British and American cucks for putting us in this hell ruled by the juice.

61908673
>>61907350
you have to love yourself, you can't trick the soul matrix system genuinely love yourself and the matrix will love you back unironically - they can sense your arrogant aura and your inner toxicity normies aren't dumb they're acting subconsciously they feel what they feel but they don't even realise it they still feel it though

61908726
>>61907350
Fucking manager asked me to “open up more” for the 5th time this year. Like nigger get a fucking clue. I don’t want to be a normalfag.

61908866
>>61907350
I hope your situation greatly improves, soon. I haven't experienced what you have so far. Tend to avoid joking/teasing at the expense of others, even the light kind other people in their life do, fully expecting that jokes/teases will be made about them. Apparently this makes me seem strangely, even suspiciously nice. Tend to tell people I've seen how jokes/teases can come to mind again and contribute to a person's doom spiral. I've seen people behind doom spiral just by talking while the rest listened. After that they usually get why I watch my words.

61909198
>>61908514
Good image.

61909269
>>61908726
"I have an extraordinarily stimulating home, family, and social life outside of work, and I try to support and bring a focused atmosphere in the office."

The clique at the office is toxic. It doesn't matter how nice and inclusive they are on the outside, the point of being in their little in-group is so they feel accepted and trusted by you, so they can strategize around what vulnerabilities they learn about you through "socialization"
It's also important to realize the clique at the office will not be composed of the most senior and productive workers. It will be largely "new" people to the corporation, who are trying to compound and roll the freshman happy-go-lucky "I made it" vibes perpetually.
Unfortunately, being a simpleton and going with the crowd at work is a way to reduce your own role, executive actions, and relevance in your life. If 20 people have to walk together and get coffee every day because.. it's what they do...they're essentially automatons, preprogrammed. If you're forced to walk at an uncomfortably brisk pace to keep up with the lead Alpha Team Member on your walks, you're being actively cucked

OP, you should be satisfied in knowing you don't fit in. You probably don't want to fit in.

61909282
>>61907350
I have a fairly unfriendly face. Keeps me from ever moving up.

61909303
>>61907350
Normalfags at work don't seem to like that I need peace and quiet to do work (I usually like to find a nice chill spot to code) and they say I'm not a "cultural fit". Pretty gay and retarded if you ask me desu.

61910258
>>61907350
It's your bodylangage. You are uptight. And tense. Alert in a way. That scream insecurities.
Seeing your post, plan to isolate from normies in the future. Solitary job or financial independance. You are too far gone. It's not a bad thing by the way.

61910271
>>61908726
>I don’t want to be a normalfag.
So don't work in an office.
Do a SOLITARY job. Yes, they exist. And if you cannot find one with enough imagination, guess what, you have a little bit of normalfagging in you.

61910291
>>61908866
Normies do not understand irony. So it's useless using irony with them, in order to subtetly pass as the smart guy. Do not joke with them. Always take them seriously. They do not want to think. To learn, to understand. They want to have immediate pleasure. Eating. Drinking. Go away for the week end. Never talk to them about profound subject. Never talk to them about politics. In fact, only talk to them about the most basic shit.

61910319
>>61908567
>Why is all of Gen Z number 4?
They're all unironically retarded. It's probably a mix of 1 & 4, bad eyelid genes, accelerated aging, and being high. Simple interactions stress them, they're like chihuahuas.

61910322
>>61907350
It is unironically what they are best at. Find the one not like the others.

Its not like thats not your money

61910263
>>61910252

61910276
>>61910263
Everyone has health expenses, you can even use it on stuff like gym equipment and shoes. Besides its totally voluntary im pretty sure and most people just do it because taxes

61910294
>>61910276
>Everyone has health expenses,
i don't bother going to doctors. i go to the dentist every 6 months. i use mine for fluoride treatments ($33 a year) and the occasional filling.
>stuff like gym equipment and shoes.
it needs to be medically necessary, which means you need to pay dr. shekelberg to write a letter to substantiate the 'need.'

61910340
>>61910263
it is not difficult to use $4400 of medical expenses once a year, but youre supposed to just save up all your receipts and use it down the line once you've made a bunch of money, but $4400/mo shouldn't be making or breaking your investment strategy anyways unless you're poor.
>>61910294
oh you're one of those.

61910348
>>61910170
I remember when I really did think that was a lot of money 10+ years ago. I was almost willing to move to California or bumfuck West Texas to make it since I was only making $110k at the time in metro Atlanta. Look at me now!

61910350
>>61910340
>it is not difficult to use $4400 of medical expenses once a year
again, they have to be qualifying medical expenses.
>oh you're one of those.
one of what?

item.title: $SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in — 77 replies — 23.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
$SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in

Open thread • Replies: 77 • Updated: 2026-02-27 09:39 UTC

OP

This is a risky startup company, but FINALLY this year they are shipping their product. This summer, in fact. They just finished a final round of dilution a month ago, and the stock just hit a critical point where it’s actively in recovery.

It’s a real car, a product that *will* ship that nerds are geeking out about, and it appears now someone big is starting to slowly acquire it.

The first model will have its flaws, but it’s an electric car that can run off the solar panels on its roof. No one has ever done that before.

And the entire fucking company’s marketcap, this Nasdaq company, is $70 million.

You’re welcome.

(Disclosure: I obviously own some moderate sized bags of this, as should you)

Early replies (first 3)

61902124
Go look the shit up on YouTube and do some research. Tech bros will buy out the first line of these as fun geek toys, and by the second and third iterations, it’s gonna start getting serious. The big boys (aka Tesla) cannot afford to let this company get too large under their toes. They’ll acquire the stock and buy them out before that happen. That’s my thesis, anyway. The company’s not perfect, it has issues. But it’s worth more than $70 million for damn sure.

61902143
>>61902111
I believe that oil,nat gas, nuclear energy, clean coal is going to make a comeback, and that the "green" stuff wont be " cool" anymore, I avoid betting on anyting "green". At least I do not think the US will care about solar and wind turbines and all that crap anymore. In the Eu, that car would look ridicolous and nobody would drive it., btw in Eu we drive diesel.

61902157
>>61902124
Almost had me interested before I saw that monstrosity

61910072
>>61909912
When rates are under 7% they're too low to be beneficial to renters.

61910074
Home prices are still growing ~2.8%/yr since May 2022, but signs of a round-off top have already appeared. Momentum is decreasing since Sep 2023. For the span of 2012 and 2020-2022 home sales prices increased so euphorically it put us at 2007 levels of momentum & momentum change.

What happens next? Between 4-10 years, coincidently aligned with the beginning window of mass boomer die-off, prices and rates will crash to a new generational low. They WONT lower prices and there WONT be buyers. There will clearly be a socially uncomfortable liquidity crisis spanning 15-20 years until they're all dead. Look to buy in 2030ish at the earliest. But you are likely to get a much better deal in 2035-2040.

None of this needed to happen if boomers didn't pump their worthless hooms during the fake manufactured virus scare. They did this. On purpose.
